articles.headline: Disney Ends Its Fight With DeSantis Over Resort Development
articles.snippet: The entertainment giant and the Florida governor have been sparring for two years over control of a tax district that encompasses Walt Disney World.
articles.abstract: The entertainment giant and the Florida governor have been sparring for two years over control of a tax district that encompasses Walt Disney World.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a stunning turn, the Walt Disney Company has dropped its fight against Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida for control over $17 billion in planned development at the Disney World theme park complex near Orlando.
articles.byline: By Brooks Barnes and J. Edward Moreno

articles.headline: Trump’s Social Media Company Opens New Avenue for Conflicts of Interest
articles.snippet: Ethics experts say Trump Media, now a publicly traded company, would present a new way for foreign actors or others to influence Donald J. Trump, if he is elected president.
articles.abstract: Ethics experts say Trump Media, now a publicly traded company, would present a new way for foreign actors or others to influence Donald J. Trump, if he is elected president.
articles.lead_paragraph: When former President Donald J. Trump’s social media company went public this week, supporters and investors betting on Mr. Trump’s political success helped drive the value of a loss-making firm through the roof. Mr. Trump ended the first day of public trading $4.6 billion richer on paper.

articles.headline: Joseph I. Lieberman, Senator and Vice-Presidential Nominee, Dies at 82
articles.snippet: He served four terms in the Senate from Connecticut and was chosen by Al Gore as his running mate in the 2000 election. He was the first Jewish candidate on a major-party ticket.
articles.abstract: He served four terms in the Senate from Connecticut and was chosen by Al Gore as his running mate in the 2000 election. He was the first Jewish candidate on a major-party ticket.
articles.lead_paragraph: Joseph I. Lieberman, Connecticut’s four-term United States senator and Vice President Al Gore’s Democratic running mate in the 2000 presidential election, which was won by George W. Bush and Dick Cheney when the Supreme Court halted a Florida ballot recount, died on Wednesday in Manhattan. He was 82.

articles.headline: In Saga of NBC and Ronna McDaniel, Perks and Perils of Partisan Talk on TV
articles.snippet: Why are television news networks so enamored with paid Beltway analysts?
articles.abstract: Why are television news networks so enamored with paid Beltway analysts?
articles.lead_paragraph: Trying to juice ratings in an election year, a major TV network hired a pair of provocative commentators from the political establishment to inject some spiky opinion into its otherwise-staid campaign coverage.
articles.byline: By Michael M. Grynbaum and John Koblin

articles.headline: The Five Minutes That Brought Down the Francis Scott Key Bridge
articles.snippet: When a massive cargo ship lost power in Baltimore, crews scrambled to control the ship and to evacuate the bridge lying ahead. But it was too late.
articles.abstract: When a massive cargo ship lost power in Baltimore, crews scrambled to control the ship and to evacuate the bridge lying ahead. But it was too late.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow our live coverage of the Francis Scott Key Bridge collapse in Baltimore.
articles.byline: By Annie Correal, Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs, Campbell Robertson, Michael Forsythe and Mike Baker

articles.headline: Why Russia’s Vast Security Services Fell Short on Deadly Attack
articles.snippet: The factors behind the failure to prevent a terrorist attack include a distrust of foreign intelligence, a focus on Ukraine and a distracting political crackdown at home.
articles.abstract: The factors behind the failure to prevent a terrorist attack include a distrust of foreign intelligence, a focus on Ukraine and a distracting political crackdown at home.
articles.lead_paragraph: A day before the U.S. embassy in Moscow put out a rare public alert this month about a possible extremist attack at a Russian concert venue, the local C.I.A. station delivered a private warning to Russian officials that included at least one additional detail: The plot in question involved an offshoot of the Islamic State known as ISIS-K.
articles.byline: By Paul Sonne, Eric Schmitt and Michael Schwirtz

articles.headline: How Justice Thomas’s ‘Nearly Adopted Daughter’ Became His Law Clerk
articles.snippet: Justice Clarence Thomas gave Crystal Clanton a home and a job after she left a conservative youth organization in controversy. Then the justice picked her for one of the most coveted positions in the legal world.
articles.abstract: Justice Clarence Thomas gave Crystal Clanton a home and a job after she left a conservative youth organization in controversy. Then the justice picked her for one of the most coveted positions in the legal world.
articles.lead_paragraph: The email went out to members of Justice Clarence Thomas’s law clerk network late last month celebrating his newest addition to an exclusive club. The justice’s selection needed no introduction.
articles.byline: By Steve Eder and Abbie VanSickle

articles.headline: ‘Shortcuts Everywhere’: How Boeing Favored Speed Over Quality
articles.snippet: Problems have plagued the manufacturer even after two fatal crashes, and many current and former employees blame its focus on making planes more quickly.
articles.abstract: Problems have plagued the manufacturer even after two fatal crashes, and many current and former employees blame its focus on making planes more quickly.
articles.lead_paragraph: In February last year, a new Southwest Airlines Boeing 737 Max plane was on one of its first flights when an automated stabilizing system appeared to malfunction, forcing the pilots to make an emergency landing soon after they took off.
articles.byline: By Niraj Chokshi, Sydney Ember and Santul Nerkar

articles.headline: ‘Winners and Losers’ as $20 Fast-Food Wage Nears in California
articles.snippet: The nation’s highest state minimum wage for fast-food workers takes effect on Monday. Owners and employees are sizing up the potential impact.
articles.abstract: The nation’s highest state minimum wage for fast-food workers takes effect on Monday. Owners and employees are sizing up the potential impact.
articles.lead_paragraph: A decade ago, Jamie Bynum poured his life savings into a barbecue restaurant now tucked between a Thai eatery and a nutrition store in a Southern California strip mall.

articles.headline: Sam Bankman-Fried Sentenced to 25 Years in Prison
articles.snippet: Mr. Bankman-Fried, who was convicted of stealing $8 billion from customers of his FTX cryptocurrency exchange, faced a maximum sentence of 110 years.
articles.abstract: Mr. Bankman-Fried, who was convicted of stealing $8 billion from customers of his FTX cryptocurrency exchange, faced a maximum sentence of 110 years.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sam Bankman-Fried, the founder of the FTX cryptocurrency exchange who was convicted of stealing billions of dollars from customers, was sentenced to 25 years in prison on Thursday, capping an extraordinary saga that upended the crypto industry and became a cautionary tale of greed and hubris.
articles.byline: By David Yaffe-Bellany and J. Edward Moreno
